author: pipermerriam
content:
Here's the current summary of things that I'm currently planning to present in the next Execution layer call to update on 4444s rollout plan.

- https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-7639 will proceed as-is
- https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-7801 has been updated to make the protocol fully isolated from the `eth` protocol
- Nethermind and Erigon are proceeding with 7801
- Geth, Nethermind, Besu, Nimbus, EthereumJS are proceeding with Portal

<@543900561460822016> has stated that using a specific date (May 1st 2025) is an undesirable activation mechanic.  I think the main reason behind this was that many users don't update other than at fork boundaries.  The two obvious options seem to be:

- Keep the May 1st 2025 activation date for 7639
- Bundle 7639 into pecra and have it activate with Pectra
- <other suggestions here>

Who's got an opinion on this?

author: arnetheduck
content:
+1 coativate with pectra or pectra + 1 rather than some arbitrary date - that said, probably doesn't matter _too_ much - our plan roughly is to provide emulate eth/68 support of deep history via portal anyway until it's clear things have settled - adding the cutoff is almost _more_ work than just serving it like that, but we'll see how it pans out.
+1 keep 7801 entirely separate from `eth` (version numbers are not a good mechanism for optional features)


one more point that I think we should have ready _before_ that date:
* fork https://github.com/eth-clients/checkpoint-sync-endpoints as `history-endpoints` where we can keep a directory of community servers serving era(1) files - this is on my eternal todo list and a low hanging  fruit that I'm happy to provide help with should someone want to beat me to it
